title: 21 Jump Street
tomatoConsensus: A smart, affectionate satire of '80s nostalgia and teen movie tropes, 21 Jump Street offers rowdy mainstream comedy with a surprisingly satisfying bite.
name: 21_Jump_Street

title: Alexander
tomatoConsensus: Even at nearly three hours long, this ponderous, talky, and emotionally distant biopic fails to illuminate Alexander's life.
name: Alexander

title: Alexander and the Terrible, Horrible, No Good, Very Bad Day
tomatoConsensus: Affably pleasant without ever trying to be anything more, Alexander and the Terrible, Horrible, No Good, Very Bad Day is a fine -- albeit forgettable -- family diversion.
name: Alexander_and_the_Terrible,_Horrible,_No_Good,_Very_Bad_Day

title: Alice in Wonderland
tomatoConsensus: Tim Burton's Alice sacrifices the book's minimal narrative coherence -- and much of its heart -- but it's an undeniable visual treat.
name: Alice_in_Wonderland

title: American Sniper
tomatoConsensus: Powered by Clint Eastwood's sure-handed direction and a gripping central performance from Bradley Cooper, American Sniper delivers a tense, vivid tribute to its real-life subject.
name: American_Sniper

title: Anastasia
awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 9 wins & 20 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Beautiful animation, an affable take on Russian history, and strong voice performances make Anastasia a winning first film from Fox animation studios.
name: Anastasia

title: And So It Goes
tomatoConsensus: And So It Goes aims for comedy, but with two talented stars stuck in a half-hearted effort from a once-mighty filmmaker, it ends in unintentional tragedy.
name: And_So_It_Goes

title: Antz
awards: Nominated for 1 BAFTA Film Award. Another 6 wins & 13 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Featuring a stellar voice cast, technically dazzling animation, and loads of good humor, Antz should delight both children and adults.
name: Antz

title: Avatar
tomatoConsensus: It might be more impressive on a technical level than as a piece of storytelling, but Avatar reaffirms James Cameron's singular gift for imaginative, absorbing filmmaking.
name: Avatar

title: A Bug's Life
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 14 wins & 19 nominations.
name: A_Bug's_Life

title: A Most Wanted Man
tomatoConsensus: Smart, subtle, and steadily absorbing, A Most Wanted Man proves once again that John le Carre books make for sharp, thoughtful thrillers.
name: A_Most_Wanted_Man

title: Begin Again
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 2 wins & 10 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Writer-director John Carney's return to musical drama isn't quite as potent as it was with Once, but thanks to charming work from its well-matched leads, Begin Again is difficult to resist.
name: Begin_Again

title: Belle de Jour
awards: Nominated for 1 BAFTA Film Award. Another 7 wins.
name: Belle_de_Jour

title: Billy Elliot
awards: Nominated for 3 Oscars. Another 58 wins & 59 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Billy Elliot is a charming movie that can evoke both laughter and tears.
name: Billy_Elliot

title: Birdman: Or (The Unexpected Virtue of Ignorance)
tomatoConsensus: A thrilling leap forward for director Alejandro Gonzlez Irritu, Birdman is an ambitious technical showcase powered by a layered story and outstanding performances from Michael Keaton and Edward Norton.
name: Birdman__Or_(The_Unexpected_Virtue_of_Ignorance)

title: Blended
tomatoConsensus: Lurching between slapstick and schmaltz without showing much of a commitment to either, Blended commits the rare Sandler sin of provoking little more than boredom.
name: Blended

title: Blow Out
tomatoConsensus: With a story inspired by Antonioni's Blow Up and a style informed by the high-gloss suspense of Hitchcock, DePalma's Blow Out is raw, politically informed, and littered with film references.
name: Blow_Out

title: Burlesque
awards: Won 1 Golden Globe. Another 4 wins & 15 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Campy and cliched, Burlesque wastes its talented cast (including a better-than-expected Christina Aguilera) on a movie that wavers uncertainly between 'bad' and 'so bad it's good.'
name: Burlesque

title: Captain America: The Winter Soldier
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 4 wins & 46 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Suspenseful and politically astute, Captain America: The Winter Soldier is a superior entry in the Avengers canon and is sure to thrill Marvel diehards.
name: Captain_America__The_Winter_Soldier

title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 13 wins & 37 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Closer to the source material than 1971's Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory, Charlie and the Chocolate Factory is for people who like their Chocolate visually appealing and dark.
name: Charlie_and_the_Chocolate_Factory

title: Clash of the Titans
tomatoConsensus: An obviously affectionate remake of the 1981 original, Louis Leterrier's Clash of the Titans doesn't offer enough visual thrills to offset the deficiencies of its script.
name: Clash_of_the_Titans

title: Contact
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 14 wins & 25 nominations.
name: Contact

title: Dances with Wolves
tomatoConsensus: A grand, sweeping epic with inarguably noble intentions and arresting cinematography, but one whose center, arguably, is not as weighty as it should be.
name: Dances_with_Wolves

title: Divergent
tomatoConsensus: With an adherence to YA formula that undercuts its individualistic message, Divergent opens its planned trilogy in disappointingly predictable fashion.
name: Divergent

title: Django Unchained
tomatoConsensus: Bold, bloody, and stylistically daring, Django Unchained is another incendiary masterpiece from Quentin Tarantino.
name: Django_Unchained

title: Dolphin Tale 2
tomatoConsensus: Much like its predecessor, Dolphin Tale 2 offers animal antics and sweet, old-fashioned drama that the whole family can enjoy.
name: Dolphin_Tale_2

title: Dracula Untold
tomatoConsensus: Neither awful enough to suck nor sharp enough to bite, Dracula Untold misses the point of its iconic character's deathless appeal.
name: Dracula_Untold

title: Dumbo
tomatoConsensus: Dumbo packs plenty of story into its brief runtime, along with all the warm animation and wonderful music you'd expect from a Disney classic.
name: Dumbo

title: Dumb and Dumber To
tomatoConsensus: Dumb and Dumber To does have its moments, but not enough of them -- and the Farrelly brothers' brand of humor is nowhere near as refreshingly transgressive as it once seemed.
name: Dumb_and_Dumber_To

title: Edge of Tomorrow
tomatoConsensus: Gripping, well-acted, funny, and clever, Edge of Tomorrow offers entertaining proof that Tom Cruise is still more than capable of shouldering the weight of a blockbuster action thriller.
name: Edge_of_Tomorrow

title: Fargo
tomatoConsensus: Violent, quirky, and darkly funny, Fargo delivers an original crime story and a wonderful performance by McDormand.
name: Fargo

title: Fast Five
tomatoConsensus: Sleek, loud, and over the top, Fast Five proudly embraces its brainless action thrills and injects new life into the franchise.
name: Fast_Five

title: Finding Nemo
tomatoConsensus: Breathtaking animation, talented vocal work, and a well-written screenplay add up to another Pixar success.
name: Finding_Nemo

title: Foxcatcher
awards: Nominated for 5 Oscars. Another 14 wins & 55 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: A chilling true crime drama, Foxcatcher offers Steve Carell, Mark Ruffalo, and Channing Tatum a chance to shine -- and all three of them rise to the challenge.
name: Foxcatcher

title: Frozen
tomatoConsensus: Beautifully animated, smartly written, and stocked with singalong songs, Frozen adds another worthy entry to the Disney canon.
name: Frozen

title: Fury
tomatoConsensus: Overall, Fury is a well-acted, suitably raw depiction of the horrors of war that offers visceral battle scenes but doesn't quite live up to its larger ambitions.
name: Fury

title: Gone Girl
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 60 wins & 126 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Dark, intelligent, and stylish to a fault, Gone Girl plays to director David Fincher's sick strengths while bringing the best out of stars Ben Affleck and Rosamund Pike.
name: Gone_Girl

title: Good Morning, Vietnam
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 7 wins & 3 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: A well-calibrated blend of manic comedy and poignant drama, Good Morning, Vietnam offers a captivating look at a wide range of Robin Williams' cinematic gifts.
name: Good_Morning,_Vietnam

title: Good Will Hunting
tomatoConsensus: It follows a predictable narrative arc, but Good Will Hunting adds enough quirks to the journey -- and is loaded with enough powerful performances -- that it remains an entertaining, emotionally rich drama.
name: Good_Will_Hunting

title: Gran Torino
awards: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 22 wins & 10 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Though a minor entry in Eastwood's body of work, Gran Torino is nevertheless a humorous, touching, and intriguing old-school parable.
name: Gran_Torino

title: Groundhog Day
awards: Won 1 BAFTA Film Award. Another 6 wins & 7 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Smart, sweet, and inventive, Groundhog Day highlights Murray's dramatic gifts while still leaving plenty of room for laughs.
name: Groundhog_Day

title: Guardians of the Galaxy
awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 22 wins & 78 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Guardians of the Galaxy is just as irreverent as fans of the frequently zany Marvel comic would expect -- as well as funny, thrilling, full of heart, and packed with visual splendor.
name: Guardians_of_the_Galaxy

title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
awards: Nominated for 3 Oscars. Another 48 wins & 76 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Thrilling, powerfully acted, and visually dazzling, Deathly Hallows Part II brings the Harry Potter franchise to a satisfying -- and suitably magical -- conclusion.
name: Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows__Part_2

title: Hector and the Search for Happiness
tomatoConsensus: Simon Pegg remains as charming as ever, but Hector and the Search for Happiness drowns his appeal in schmaltz.
name: Hector_and_the_Search_for_Happiness

title: Hercules
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 10 wins & 14 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Fast-paced and packed with dozens of pop culture references, Hercules might not measure up with the true classics of the Disney pantheon, but it's still plenty of fun.
name: Hercules

title: Homeland
awards: Won 5 Golden Globes. Another 43 wins & 110 nominations.
name: Homeland

title: Horrible Bosses 2
tomatoConsensus: Horrible Bosses 2 may trigger a few belly laughs among big fans of the original, but all in all, it's a waste of a strong cast that fails to justify its own existence.
name: Horrible_Bosses_2

title: How to Train Your Dragon 2
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 16 wins & 44 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Exciting, emotionally resonant, and beautifully animated, How to Train Your Dragon 2 builds on its predecessor's successes just the way a sequel should.
name: How_to_Train_Your_Dragon_2

title: Interview with the Vampire: The Vampire Chronicles
awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 20 wins & 18 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Despite lacking some of the book's subtler shadings, and suffering from some clumsy casting, Interview with a Vampire benefits from Neil Jordan's atmospheric direction and a surfeit of gothic thrills.
name: Interview_with_the_Vampire__The_Vampire_Chronicles

title: In Her Shoes
awards: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 1 win & 5 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Honesty and solid performances make In Her Shoes a solid fit for all audiences.
name: In_Her_Shoes

title: Iron Man 2
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 6 wins & 38 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: It isn't quite the breath of fresh air that Iron Man was, but this sequel comes close with solid performances and an action-packed plot.
name: Iron_Man_2

title: Iron Man 3
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 21 wins & 40 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: With the help of its charismatic lead, some impressive action sequences, and even a few surprises, Iron Man 3 is a witty, entertaining adventure and a strong addition to the Marvel canon.
name: Iron_Man_3

title: I Am Big Bird: The Caroll Spinney Story
name: I_Am_Big_Bird__The_Caroll_Spinney_Story

title: John Tucker Must Die
tomatoConsensus: This derivitive teen comedy tries to go for cute when it could use more bite.
name: John_Tucker_Must_Die

title: Justin Bieber: Never Say Never
tomatoConsensus: As a tour documentary, it's rather uninspired -- but as a 3D glimpse of a building pop culture phenomenon, Never Say Never is undeniably entertaining.
name: Justin_Bieber__Never_Say_Never

title: Kick-Ass
tomatoConsensus: Not for the faint of heart, Kick-Ass takes the comic adaptation genre to new levels of visual style, bloody violence, and gleeful profanity.
name: Kick-Ass

title: Kick-Ass 2
tomatoConsensus: Kick-Ass 2 falls short in its attempt to emulate the original's unique blend of ultra-violence and ironic humor.
name: Kick-Ass_2

title: Kingsman: The Secret Service
tomatoConsensus: Stylish, subversive, and above all fun, Kingsman: The Secret Service finds director Matthew Vaughn sending up the spy genre with gleeful abandon.
name: Kingsman__The_Secret_Service

title: Kurt Cobain: Montage of Heck
tomatoConsensus: Kurt Cobain: Montage of Heck makes a persuasive case for its subject without resorting to hagiography -- and includes plenty of rare and unreleased footage for fans.
name: Kurt_Cobain__Montage_of_Heck

title: La Camioneta: The Journey of One American School Bus
name: La_Camioneta__The_Journey_of_One_American_School_Bus

title: Legally Blonde
awards: Nominated for 2 Golden Globes. Another 6 wins & 10 nominations.
name: Legally_Blonde

title: Leviathan
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 20 wins & 30 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Leviathan lives up to its title, offering trenchant, well-crafted social satire on a suitably grand scale.
name: Leviathan

title: Life of Crime
tomatoConsensus: It may not stand shoulder-to-shoulder with the best Elmore Leonard adaptations, but Life of Crime has enough ambling charm -- and a sharp enough cast -- to get by.
name: Life_of_Crime

title: Lilting
awards: Nominated for 1 BAFTA Film Award. Another 1 win & 5 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Skillfully weaving multiple delicate tonal strands into a quietly affecting whole, Lilting serves as a thoroughly compelling calling card for writer-director Hong Khaou.
name: Lilting

title: Limitless
tomatoConsensus: Although its script is uneven, Neil Burger directs Limitless with plenty of visual panache, and Bradley Cooper makes for a charismatic star.
name: Limitless

title: Love, Rosie
tomatoConsensus: Lilly Collins and Sam Claflin are appealing, and they give it their all, but they're undone by Love, Rosie's silly, cliched storyline.
name: Love,_Rosie

title: Love Actually
awards: Nominated for 2 Golden Globes. Another 10 wins & 24 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: A sugary tale overstuffed with too many stories. Still, the cast charms.
name: Love_Actually

title: Lucy
tomatoConsensus: Enthusiastic and silly, Lucy powers through the movie's logic gaps with cheesy thrills plus Scarlett Johansson's charm -- and mostly succeeds at it.
name: Lucy

title: Magic in the Moonlight
tomatoConsensus: While far from a failure, Magic in the Moonlight is too slight to stand with Woody Allen's finest work.
name: Magic_in_the_Moonlight

title: Magic Mike
tomatoConsensus: Magic Mike's sensitive direction, smart screenplay, and strong performances allow audiences to have their beefcake and eat it too.
name: Magic_Mike

title: Maleficent
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 9 wins & 35 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Angelina Jolie's magnetic performance outshines Maleficent's dazzling special effects; unfortunately, the movie around them fails to justify all that impressive effort.
name: Maleficent

title: Maps to the Stars
awards: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 6 wins & 12 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Narratively unwieldy and tonally jumbled, Maps to the Stars still has enough bite to satisfy David Cronenberg fans in need of a coolly acidic fix.
name: Maps_to_the_Stars

title: Million Dollar Arm
tomatoConsensus: Pleasant to a fault, Million Dollar Arm is a middle-of-the-plate pitch that coasts on Jon Hamm's considerable charm without adding any truly original curves to Disney's inspirational sports formula.
name: Million_Dollar_Arm

title: Mommie Dearest
tomatoConsensus: Director Frank Perry's campy melodrama certainly doesn't lack for conviction, and neither does Faye Dunaway's performance in the title role; unfortunately, it does lack enough narrative discipline to offer much more than guilty pleasure.
name: Mommie_Dearest

title: Mommy
tomatoConsensus: As challenging as it is rewarding, Mommy finds writer-director Xavier Dolan taking another impressive step forward.
name: Mommy

title: Moonrise Kingdom
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 47 wins & 91 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Warm, whimsical, and poignant, the immaculately framed and beautifully acted Moonrise Kingdom presents writer/director Wes Anderson at his idiosyncratic best.
name: Moonrise_Kingdom

title: Moonstruck
tomatoConsensus: Led by energetic performances from Nicolas Cage and Cher, Moonstruck is an exuberantly funny tribute to love and one of the decade's most appealing comedies.
name: Moonstruck

title: Mr. Turner
awards: Nominated for 4 Oscars. Another 27 wins & 42 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Led by a masterful performance from Timothy Spall and brilliantly directed by Mike Leigh, Mr. Turner is a superior Hollywood biopic.
name: Mr._Turner

title: Mr. & Mrs. Smith
tomatoConsensus: Although this action-romance suffers from weak writing and one too many explosions, the chemistry generated by onscreen couple Pitt and Jolie is palpable enough to make this a thoroughly enjoyable summer action flick.
name: Mr.___Mrs._Smith

title: Mrs. Doubtfire
tomatoConsensus: On paper, Mrs. Doubtfire might seem excessively broad or sentimental, but Robin Williams shines so brightly in the title role that the end result is difficult to resist.
name: Mrs._Doubtfire

title: My Own Private Idaho
tomatoConsensus: A tantalizing glimpse of a talented director and his stars all at the top of their respective games, Gus Van Sant's loose reworking of Henry IV is smart, sad and audacious.
name: My_Own_Private_Idaho

title: Neighbors
tomatoConsensus: With plenty of bawdy humor evenly spread between its well-matched stars, Neighbors earns its R rating -- and filmgoers' laughs.
name: Neighbors

title: Oliver & Company
awards: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 1 win & 2 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Oliver & Company is a decidedly lesser effort in the Disney canon, with lackluster songs, stiff animation, and a thoroughly predictable plot.
name: Oliver___Company

title: One Chance
awards: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 1 win & 3 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Predictable and sentimental, yet thoroughly agreeable, One Chance is an unapologetic crowd-pleaser that achieves its admittedly modest goals.
name: One_Chance

title: Paddington
awards: Nominated for 1 BAFTA Film Award. Another 1 win & 4 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Paddington brings a beloved children's character into the 21st century without sacrificing his essential charm, delivering a family-friendly adventure as irresistibly cuddly as its star.
name: Paddington

title: Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl
awards: Nominated for 5 Oscars. Another 31 wins & 77 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: May leave you exhausted like the theme park ride that inspired it; however, you'll have a good time when it's over.
name: Pirates_of_the_Caribbean__The_Curse_of_the_Black_Pearl

title: Pocahontas
tomatoConsensus: Pocahontas means well, and has moments of startling beauty, but it's largely a bland, uninspired effort, with uneven plotting and an unfortunate lack of fun.
name: Pocahontas

title: Pride & Prejudice
awards: Nominated for 4 Oscars. Another 18 wins & 41 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Sure, it's another adaptation of cinema's fave Jane Austen novel, but key performances and a modern filmmaking sensibility make this familiar period piece fresh and enjoyable.
name: Pride___Prejudice

title: Prometheus
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 6 wins & 34 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Ridley Scott's ambitious quasi-prequel to Alien may not answer all of its big questions, but it's redeemed by its haunting visual grandeur and compelling performances -- particularly Michael Fassbender as a fastidious android.
name: Prometheus

title: Quantum of Solace
awards: Nominated for 2 BAFTA Film Awards. Another 4 wins & 27 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Brutal and breathless, Quantum Of Solace delivers tender emotions along with frenetic action. Not as good as franchise reboot Casino Royale, but still an impressive entry to the Bond canon.
name: Quantum_of_Solace

title: Ratatouille
tomatoConsensus: Pixar succeeds again with Ratatouille, a stunningly animated film with fast pacing, memorable characters, and overall good humor.
name: Ratatouille

title: Rise of the Planet of the Apes
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 18 wins & 32 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Led by Rupert Wyatt's stylish direction, some impressive special effects, and a mesmerizing performance by Andy Serkis, Rise of the Planet of the Apes breathes unlikely new life into a long-running franchise.
name: Rise_of_the_Planet_of_the_Apes

title: Rocky Balboa
tomatoConsensus: Implausible but entertaining and poignant, Rocky Balboa finds the champ in fighting form for the first time in years.
name: Rocky_Balboa

title: Run Lola Run
awards: Nominated for 1 BAFTA Film Award. Another 29 wins & 16 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: More fun than a barrel of Jean-Paul Sartre, pic's energy riffs on an engaging love story and really human performances while offering a series of what-ifs and a blood-stirring soundtrack.
name: Run_Lola_Run

title: School of Rock
awards: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 8 wins & 13 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Black's exuberant, gleeful performance turns School of Rock into a hilarious, rocking good time.
name: School_of_Rock

title: Se7en
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 27 wins & 18 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: A brutal, relentlessly grimy shocker with taut performances, slick gore effects, and a haunting finale.
name: Se7en

title: Selma
tomatoConsensus: Fueled by a gripping performance from David Oyelowo, Selma draws inspiration and dramatic power from the life and death of Martin Luther King, Jr. -- but doesn't ignore how far we remain from the ideals his work embodied.
name: Selma

title: Serena
tomatoConsensus: Serena unites an impressive array of talent on either side of the cameras -- then leaves viewers to wonder how it all went so wrong.
name: Serena

title: Silver Linings Playbook
tomatoConsensus: Silver Linings Playbook walks a tricky thematic tightrope, but David O. Russell's sensitive direction and some sharp work from a talented cast gives it true balance.
name: Silver_Linings_Playbook

title: Sleeping Beauty
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 1 win & 3 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: This Disney dreamscape contains moments of grandeur, with its lush colors, magical air, one of the most menacing villains in the Disney canon.
name: Sleeping_Beauty

title: Sleepy Hollow
tomatoConsensus: Sleepy Hollow entertains with its stunning visuals and creepy atmosphere.
name: Sleepy_Hollow

title: Soul Surfer
tomatoConsensus: There's an amazing true story at the heart of Soul Surfer -- and unfortunately, it's drowned by waves of Hollywood cheese.
name: Soul_Surfer

title: Stardust
tomatoConsensus: A faithful interpretation that captures the spirit of whimsy, action, and off-kilter humor of Neil Gaiman, Stardust juggles multiple genres and tones to create a fantastical experience.
name: Stardust

title: Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope
tomatoConsensus: A legendarily expansive and ambitious start to the sci-fi saga, George Lucas opened our eyes to the possiblites of blockbuster filmmaking and things have never been the same.
name: Star_Wars__Episode_IV_-_A_New_Hope

title: Tammy
tomatoConsensus: Melissa McCarthy remains an engaging screen presence, but her efforts aren't enough to keep the jumbled Tammy on track.
name: Tammy

title: Testament of Youth
tomatoConsensus: Testament of Youth is well-acted and beautifully filmed, adding up to an enriching if not adventurous experience for fans of British period dramas.
name: Testament_of_Youth

title: Thelma & Louise
tomatoConsensus: Simultaneously funny, heartbreaking, and peppered with action, Ridley Scott's Thelma & Louise is a potent, well-acted road movie that transcends the feminist message at its core.
name: Thelma___Louise

title: There Will Be Blood
tomatoConsensus: Widely touted as a masterpiece, this sparse and sprawling epic about the underhanded 'heroes' of capitalism boasts incredible performances by leads Daniel Day-Lewis and Paul Dano, and is director Paul Thomas Anderson's best work to date.
name: There_Will_Be_Blood

title: The AristoCats
tomatoConsensus: Though The Aristocats is a mostly middling effort for Disney, it is redeemed by terrific work from its voice cast and some jazzy tunes.
name: The_AristoCats

title: The Avengers
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 31 wins & 66 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: With a script that never forgets its heroes' humanity and no shortage of superpowered set pieces, The Avengers lives up to its hype -- and raises the bar for Marvel at the movies.
name: The_Avengers

title: The Best of Me
tomatoConsensus: At nine films and counting, the line between Nicholas Sparks film fans and detractors is clear, and The Best of Me will change few minds on either side of the divide.
name: The_Best_of_Me

title: The Big Chill
awards: Nominated for 3 Oscars. Another 4 wins & 4 nominations.
name: The_Big_Chill

title: The Bridges of Madison County
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 8 wins & 11 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Sentimental, slow, schmaltzy, and very satisfying, The Bridges of Madison County finds Clint Eastwood adapting a bestseller with heft, wit, and grace.
name: The_Bridges_of_Madison_County

title: The Croods
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 7 wins & 37 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: While it may not be as (ahem) evolved as the best modern animated fare, The Croods will prove solidly entertaining for families seeking a fast-paced, funny cartoon adventure.
name: The_Croods

title: The Departed
tomatoConsensus: Featuring outstanding work from an excellent cast that includes Jack Nicholson, Leonardo DiCaprio, and Matt Damon, The Departed is a thoroughly engrossing gangster drama with the gritty authenticity and soupy morality that has infused director Martin Scorsese's past triumphs.
name: The_Departed

title: The Devil Wears Prada
awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 23 wins & 36 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: A rare film that surpasses the quality of its source novel, this Devil is a witty expose of New York's fashion scene, with Meryl Streep in top form and Anne Hathaway more than holding her own.
name: The_Devil_Wears_Prada

title: The Drop
tomatoConsensus: There's no shortage of similarly themed crime dramas, but The Drop rises above the pack with a smartly written script and strong cast.
name: The_Drop

title: The English Patient
tomatoConsensus: Though it suffers from excessive length and ambition, director Minghella's adaptation of the Michael Ondaatje novel is complex, powerful, and moving.
name: The_English_Patient

title: The Equalizer
tomatoConsensus: The Equalizer is more stylishly violent than meaningful, but with Antoine Fuqua behind the cameras and Denzel Washington dispensing justice, it delivers.
name: The_Equalizer

title: The Expendables 3
tomatoConsensus: Like its predecessors, Expendables 3 offers a modicum of all-star thrills for old-school action thriller aficionados -- but given all the talent assembled, it should have been a lot more fun.
name: The_Expendables_3

title: The Fox and the Hound
tomatoConsensus: The Fox and the Hound is a likeable, charming, unassuming effort that manages to transcend its thin, predictable plot.
name: The_Fox_and_the_Hound

title: The Gambler
tomatoConsensus: Well-paced and reasonably entertaining in its own right, The Gambler still suffers from comparisons to the James Caan classic that inspired it.
name: The_Gambler

title: The Girl Next Door
tomatoConsensus: The movie borrows heavily from Risky Business, though Hirsch and Cuthbert are appealing leads.
name: The_Girl_Next_Door

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
tomatoConsensus: Brutal yet captivating, The Girl With the Dragon Tattoo is the result of David Fincher working at his lurid best with total role commitment from star Rooney Mara.
name: The_Girl_with_the_Dragon_Tattoo

title: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
tomatoConsensus: Arguably the greatest of the spaghetti westerns, this epic features a compelling story, memorable performances, breathtaking landscapes, and a haunting score.
name: The_Good,_the_Bad_and_the_Ugly

title: The Grand Budapest Hotel
tomatoConsensus: Typically stylish but deceptively thoughtful, The Grand Budapest Hotel finds Wes Anderson once again using ornate visual environments to explore deeply emotional ideas.
name: The_Grand_Budapest_Hotel

title: The Great Escape
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 4 wins & 5 nominations.
name: The_Great_Escape

title: The Green Mile
awards: Nominated for 4 Oscars. Another 15 wins & 23 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Though The Green Mile is long, critics say it's an absorbing, emotionally powerful experience.
name: The_Green_Mile

title: The Hangover
awards: Won 1 Golden Globe. Another 8 wins & 21 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: With a clever script and hilarious interplay among the cast, The Hangover nails just the right tone of raunchy humor, and the non-stop laughs overshadow any flaw.
name: The_Hangover

title: The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey
awards: Nominated for 3 Oscars. Another 12 wins & 58 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Peter Jackson's return to Middle-earth is an earnest, visually resplendent trip, but the film's deliberate pace robs the material of some of its majesty.
name: The_Hobbit__An_Unexpected_Journey

title: The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 2 wins & 34 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Though somewhat overwhelmed by its own spectacle, The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies ends Peter Jackson's second Middle-earth trilogy on a reasonably satisfying note.
name: The_Hobbit__The_Battle_of_the_Five_Armies

title: The Hundred-Foot Journey
awards: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 2 wins & 1 nomination.
tomatoConsensus: Director Lasse Hallstrom does lovely work and Helen Mirren is always worth watching, but The Hundred-Foot Journey travels predictable ground already covered by countless feel-good dramedies.
name: The_Hundred-Foot_Journey

title: The King's Speech
tomatoConsensus: Colin Firth gives a masterful performance in The King's Speech, a predictable but stylishly produced and rousing period drama.
name: The_King's_Speech

title: The Lego Movie
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 60 wins & 53 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Boasting beautiful animation, a charming voice cast, laugh-a-minute gags, and a surprisingly thoughtful story, The Lego Movie is colorful fun for all ages.
name: The_Lego_Movie

title: The Little Mermaid
tomatoConsensus: The Little Mermaid ushered in a new golden era for Disney animation with warm and charming hand-drawn characters and catchy musical sequences.
name: The_Little_Mermaid

title: The Monuments Men
tomatoConsensus: Its intentions are noble and its cast is impressive, but neither can compensate for The Monuments Men's stiffly nostalgic tone and curiously slack narrative.
name: The_Monuments_Men

title: The Mummy
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 5 wins & 19 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: It's difficult to make a persuasive argument for The Mummy as any kind of meaningful cinematic achievement, but it's undeniably fun to watch.
name: The_Mummy

title: The Queen
tomatoConsensus: Full of wit, humor, and pathos, Stephen Frears' moving portrait of the British royals during the period after Princess Diana's death features not one but two remarkable performances, that of Helen Mirren as Queen Elizabeth II and Michael Sheen as the newly-ordained Prime Minister Tony Blair. They embody their characters and lay bare the motivations behind these prominent people, giving viewers a glimpse into the inner workings of the British monarchy.
name: The_Queen

title: The Rewrite
tomatoConsensus: The Rewrite's unremarkable plot is enlivened considerably by its likable cast, adding up to a comedy that coasts capably on the charms of Hugh Grant and his co-stars.
name: The_Rewrite

title: The Shawshank Redemption
awards: Nominated for 7 Oscars. Another 16 wins & 16 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: The Shawshank Redemption is an uplifting, deeply satisfying prison drama with sensitive direction and fine performances.
name: The_Shawshank_Redemption

title: The Silence of the Lambs
tomatoConsensus: Director Jonathan Demme's smart, taut thriller teeters on the edge between psychological study and all-out horror, and benefits greatly from stellar performances by Anthony Hopkins and Jodie Foster.
name: The_Silence_of_the_Lambs

title: The Simpsons Movie
awards: Nominated for 1 Golden Globe. Another 7 wins & 26 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: The Simpsons Movie contains the hearty laughs, biting satire, and honest portrayal of an American family that makes the show so popular. And it boasts slicker animation and polished writing that hearkens back to the show's glory days.
name: The_Simpsons_Movie

title: The Social Network
tomatoConsensus: Impeccably scripted, beautifully directed, and filled with fine performances, The Social Network is a riveting, ambitious example of modern filmmaking at its finest.
name: The_Social_Network

title: The Talented Mr. Ripley
awards: Nominated for 5 Oscars. Another 16 wins & 67 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: With Matt Damon's unsettling performance offering a darkly twisted counterpoint to Anthony Minghella's glossy direction, The Talented Mr. Ripley is a suspense thriller that lingers.
name: The_Talented_Mr._Ripley

title: The Trip to Italy
tomatoConsensus: While perhaps not quite as fresh as Coogan and Brydon's original voyage in The Trip, The Trip to Italy still proves a thoroughly agreeable sequel.
name: The_Trip_to_Italy

title: The Voices
tomatoConsensus: The Voices gives Ryan Reynolds an opportunity to deliver a highlight-reel performance -- and offers an off-kilter treat for fans of black comedies.
name: The_Voices

title: The Water Diviner
tomatoConsensus: The Water Diviner finds Russell Crowe on somewhat uncertain footing as a director, but he's rescued by a strong performance from himself in the leading role.
name: The_Water_Diviner

title: The White Haired Witch of Lunar Kingdom
name: The_White_Haired_Witch_of_Lunar_Kingdom

title: The Wolf of Wall Street
awards: Nominated for 5 Oscars. Another 37 wins & 118 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Funny, self-referential, and irreverent to a fault, The Wolf of Wall Street finds Martin Scorsese and Leonardo DiCaprio at their most infectiously dynamic.
name: The_Wolf_of_Wall_Street

title: Thor: The Dark World
tomatoConsensus: It may not be the finest film to come from the Marvel Universe, but Thor: The Dark World still offers plenty of the humor and high-stakes action that fans have come to expect.
name: Thor__The_Dark_World

title: Titanic
tomatoConsensus: A mostly unqualified triumph for James Cameron, who offers a dizzying blend of spectacular visuals and old-fashioned melodrama.
name: Titanic

title: Tommy Boy
tomatoConsensus: Though it benefits from the comic charms of its two leads, Tommy Boy too often feels like a familiar sketch stretched thin.
name: Tommy_Boy

title: Trainspotting
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 20 wins & 18 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: A brutal, often times funny, other times terrifying portrayal of drug addiction in Edinburgh. Not for the faint of heart, but well worth viewing as a realistic and entertaining reminder of the horrors of drug use.
name: Trainspotting

title: Trash
awards: Nominated for 1 BAFTA Film Award. Another 1 win & 2 nominations.
name: Trash

title: Unbroken
awards: Nominated for 3 Oscars. Another 10 wins & 26 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Unbroken is undoubtedly well-intentioned, but it hits a few too many of the expected prestige-pic beats to register as strongly as it should.
name: Unbroken

title: Valkyrie
tomatoConsensus: Given the subject matter, Valkyrie could have been an outstanding historical thriller, but settles for being a mildly entertaining, but disposable yarn.
name: Valkyrie

title: Walk the Line
tomatoConsensus: Superior acting and authentic crooning capture the emotional subtleties of the legend of Johnny Cash and his inevitable downfall with a freshness that is a pleasure to watch.
name: Walk_the_Line

title: Warrior
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 3 wins & 15 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: Warrior relies on many of the cliches that critics of the genre love to mock -- and it transcends them with gripping action, powerful acting, and heart.
name: Warrior

title: Wassup Rockers
tomatoConsensus: As usual with Clark's films, the fixation on kids is rather creepy, plus the plot eventually runs off the rails into camp.
name: Wassup_Rockers

title: Watchmen
tomatoConsensus: Gritty and visually striking, Watchmen is a faithful adaptation of Alan Moore's graphic novel, but its complex narrative structure may make it difficult for it to appeal to viewers not already familiar with the source material.
name: Watchmen

title: Wet Hot American Summer
tomatoConsensus: As comedy, Wet Hot American Summer is a slapdash, fragmented affair that misses more often than hits. As parody, it fails because it attempts to satirize something ridiculous and self-parodying in itself.
name: Wet_Hot_American_Summer

title: What We Do in the Shadows
tomatoConsensus: Smarter, fresher, and funnier than a modern vampire movie has any right to be, What We Do in the Shadows is bloody good fun.
name: What_We_Do_in_the_Shadows

title: Whiplash
tomatoConsensus: Intense, inspiring, and well-acted, Whiplash is a brilliant sophomore effort from director Damien Chazelle and a riveting vehicle for stars J.K. Simmons and Miles Teller.
name: Whiplash

title: Who Framed Roger Rabbit
tomatoConsensus: Who Framed Roger Rabbit? is an innovative and entertaining film that features a groundbreaking mix of live action and animation, with a touching and original story to boot.
name: Who_Framed_Roger_Rabbit

title: Wish I Was Here
tomatoConsensus: There's no denying Wish I Was Here is heartfelt, but it covers narrative ground that's already been well trod -- particularly by director Zach Braff's previous features.
name: Wish_I_Was_Here

title: X-Men: Days of Future Past
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 7 wins & 33 nominations.
tomatoConsensus: X-Men: Days of Future Past combines the best elements of the series to produce a satisfyingly fast-paced outing that ranks among the franchise's finest installments.
name: X-Men__Days_of_Future_Past

title: X-Men: First Class
tomatoConsensus: With a strong script, stylish direction, and powerful performances from its well-rounded cast, X-Men: First Class is a welcome return to form for the franchise.
name: X-Men__First_Class

title: Yves Saint Laurent
tomatoConsensus: While it boasts its share of fine performances, Yves Saint Laurent is also disappointingly bland and formulaic -- especially given its subject's dazzling reputation.
name: Yves_Saint_Laurent

title: Zombieland
tomatoConsensus: Wickedly funny and featuring plenty of gore, Zombieland is proof that the zombie subgenre is far from dead.
name: Zombieland
